conclusion: Understanding the problem setup and what needs to be found
Basketball of mass m dropped from height H
After collision, basketball reaches height h
Air resistance is lambda times gravitational force
Ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity is constant
Need to find the ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity
Net force downward before collision is mg(1-lambda)
Effective acceleration before collision is g(1-lambda)
Velocity just before impact is v_pre = sqrt(2g(1-lambda)H)
Net force downward after collision is mg(1+lambda)
Effective acceleration after collision is g(1+lambda)
Velocity after collision is v_post = sqrt(2g(1+lambda)h)
Ratio of velocities is e = sqrt((1+lambda)h/(1-lambda)H)
Express h in terms of H, lambda, and e
Substitute h expression into constraint lambda < (H-h)/(H+h)
Determine ratio e = sqrt(h/H) based on constraints
Final answer: ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity is sqrt(h/H)
